name: fulsomely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that expresses a lot of admiration or praise for someone, often too much, in a way that does not sound sincere: He thanked her fulsomely for her help. She praised England's head coach fulsomely. See
fulsome
More examplesFewer examplesShe accidentally stood on my foot and apologised fulsomely for doing so."Ah, my favourite people!" he exclaimed fulsomely.She greeted me fulsomely when Waino first introduced us.
